N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 38.20 - Disposal of radioactive material

State Regulations
(a) No person shall dispose of any
radioactive material except by transfer to an authorized recipient or by one of
the following methods: (1)
by decay in
storage in accordance with a license condition authorizing this practice; or
(2)
by release in effluents in
accordance with the regulations of the New York State Department of

Environmental Conservation in 6 NYCRR Part
380. (b) [Reserved]
(c) Each licensee or registrant shall dispose
of unused and unneeded radioactive materials, in a timely manner. Radioactive
material which has not been used under a license or registration for a period
of 24 months, and radioactive waste which has not been accessed for a period of
24 months shall be considered unused and unneeded and shall be disposed of
forthwith. (d) Each licensee or
registrant involved in the transfer for disposal or disposal of radioactive
waste shall comply with the provisions of the title 10 of the Code of Federal

Regulations, part 20, section 20.2006 and appendix G, January 1, 1997
edition[FN1]. [FN1] The documents referenced in this Part are available
for review and copying at the Department of Labor, State Campus, Bldg. 12, Rm. 509, Albany, NY or the Department of State, 41 State St., Albany, NY. Notes
